comment: Had a 12 page final, get ready to write. However, he provides plenty of resources and is extremely helpful. He gives wonderful feedback and will work with you. Hes the best english teacher there is. Easy A. Enjoyed taking his class.
Professor Bradburd is one of the best I've had. His class is very straightforward and easy to get an A in. Just follow the guidelines and you're golden.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Bradburd is amazing! I am currently taking his online ENGL 1102 course, and he is super clear in his directions for assignments and very accessible/understanding if any help is needed outside of the course. He starts the final paper mid-semester to give everyone a fair chance to build it up in time for the deadline. I 100% recommend!

His class was mostly made up of assignments that didn't take more than a day to finish. He would occasionally assign quizzes but there's no lockdown or webcam! However, towards the end of the semester, he assigned a 12-page final but made it way easier to finish it (broke it up into sections). I would 100% retake this class.

Class is very structured, week by week he has deadlines for assignments which will set you up for success if done on time. Very good at communicating, lenient as well with deadlines if you communicate on your end as well. A substantial amount of writing, but nothing terrible.

The class is very well planned, and the instructions are always clear. The assignments are not difficult they just take time to complete so make sure to give yourself plenty of time for each assignment. Professor Bradburd is quick to respond to emails and gives great feedback.

Professor Bradburd is very understanding. As long as you try and communicate with him, he doesn't really care about late homework. He replies to emails fairly fast. Helpful if you need help with an assignment because some can be confusing on the way it's worded or just how to go about it. I would 100% recommend taking him.

He is a really nice professor! He tries to help a lot on your assignments and sometimes will make time to meet up to help you out. There will be assignments that will take time to do it but if your try your best and ask for help... you will pass! Videos are horrible by the way but lectures helps u alot!

Super nice guy that wants you to do well. It was my first online class ever so I was a mess and he essentially let me do everything that I missed at the end of the semester. He has mediocre lecture videos and his assignments are sometimes a little vague but he makes up for it by being incredibly helpful and understanding.

Has weekly modules, weekly quizzes, some discussion posts, and written response questions. Each week will vary on how much work there is, but if you can write decently and at least try to support your answer/opinion, he will literally give you almost full credit. Lots of busy work, but that is just time management. Gives great feedback.

I'm not sure theres a professor I could recommend less than Mr B. As a person, I'm sure he's fine but as a professor this class was awful. Convoluted assignments, monotone lectures, SO much reading (easily 100+ pieces of literature to read), and quizzes/tests that are so incredibly specific that it becomes very hard to do well in this class. 0/10.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This has been my favorite professor of my entire School career. During the semester i was working and it was my first semester in collage. I was stressed with the work load. And at the end he gave me two weeks to turn everything in for half credit. But in reality gave me full credit. He was so helpful and he response to everyone. He is great!

Halfway through the semester I became ill and was unable to hand in certain assignments on time but Professor Bradburd remained patient and understanding with me. He helped me to map out a course of action and checked in with me frequently. He's the best teacher I've had so far in my College Career - very caring and knows his stuff about English!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is amazing. I was behind on a lot of work this semester due to personal problems and was failing the class the last 2 weeks of the semester. He let me resubmit assignments, graded any work I turned in and worked with me so much. There's obviously still a decent amount fo work that goes into this class, but if you can, take his class!
Professor Bradburd really cares about you and wants you to pass the class. He wants you to do well and will help you any way he can. Make sure you go to class, though.

This man's compassion cannot be understated. His love of this subject shows, and he is able to teach this class online in a way that connects. If you are in doubt, talk to him. About anything, even if the issue isn't stemming from his class, he will do his best to help you get the best grade you can get. I didn't have a favorite teacher before now.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Mr. B is the absolute best professor I have ever taken. Yes, there is a decent amount of work but all of the work can be completed rather quickly. He includes opt. modules which can boost your grade and is very understanding if you need more time to complete anything. Overall amazing person and professor.

The professor is absolutely amazing. The course itself is packed full of reading, but that will come with any professor who is teaching this course. He makes you complete 4 optional modules out of about 10 optionals, and the rest is mandatory work. Everything is always due on Friday night, and he makes he expectations very clear.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: He is a super kind guy and is willing to help. He gives a lot of work but nothing you cant handle. I mean it is a lot of work mainly cause I hate literature, but sweet guy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I've never felt confident in my writing but after taking this class I've certainly improved. Very nice professor, happy to help, and he'll work with the class on grading. I took a hybrid and had no trouble at all keeping up with the assignments. Very well structured class.

This class is a grade you truly have to work for. There is so much work to complete you just might think he is crazy but he genuinely loves teaching literature. Out of all the work he gives , the good part about it is that he is caring and doesnt mind opening back up missed assignments quizzes etc.. You will pass with little effort just talk to him
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: He's accommodating for his students and gives good feedback. Fair grader with a clear grading criteria. However, the amount of work required for this gen ed class is absurd. In total, there were 23 modules (readings), 21 quizzes, 21 written responses, 2 short answer tests, 7 discussions, 7 essays, and a 5 page final paper. Decide for yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you're not a literature art major, then I would recommend not taking this class! I was so overwhelmed by the amount of work he gives for this class! The recorded lectures are extremely boring, he grades you on very specific items and things! overall, my advice is to stay away unless you like to read every day.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: If you aren't completely devoted to English, don't take him. Professor Bradburd is super nice and understanding but he assigns reading every single night and sometimes they're super long and time consuming. There are pop quizzes every once in a while and they're all based off the text. You have to get the2 books for the class. Would not recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is one of the best English teachers I have had. He has clear criteria and there are 5 essays assigned. English isn't my best subject, but i managed high B's and low A's on my essays. The final essay is worth 20%. He also reads your essays and edits it if you ask. If you think he made a mistake grading your essay, he will reread and re-grade it.

Mr. Bradburd was my first college English teacher, and honestly I am more than proud that I had the opportunity to take him. He makes it clear what we will be doing and the due dates. He is very reasonable to personals issue if you consult with him. Overall, he is a GREAT professor, the class isn't too hard, but be ready to write papers!
Genuinely cares about the well-being of the student and that they are understanding the material. Very helpful
Mr. B is a good teacher. He is a petty grader when it comes to discussion posts and papers. Getting an A won't be easy. Nice man though!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you're not an English major don't take this class. If you're not big on reading DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! He is a nice person, very understanding, good guy in general. But you will have a reading assignment EVERY SINGLE NIGHT, and he assigns SO MUCH WORK. This class is honestly so miserable, be ready to work your butt off.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: I can honestly say Mr. B has been my favorite professor thus far in college. He is so inspiring, caring, and willing to work with you in any way. If you have the opportunity, please take him. He is AMAZING! You will come out a much stronger writer.

One of my favorite professors of all time. Cares more about student success than anything, gives extra time on assignments, loves his subject. There is a good amount of homework and papers, but he makes sure it is completely manageable and sometimes pushes back deadlines.  Pretty easy grader, and a very nice man overall.

AMAZING English professor! Truly cares for his students and their success in his class and in their others. DOES EXPECT YOUT TO READ EVERY NIGHT! But, has great lectures in class! Very deep and educated in what he does, if you are an English major you defiantly want to take him! Easy and fun class if you participate and do your work!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: He's extremely nice and really wants his students to do well. He makes sure his students aren't struggling, and even makes sure we're prepared for future english classes.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He knows a great deal about literature and loves what he does. He's easy going and will work with you if you ask. There is a great deal of reading and you will definitely need your book but I would absolutely take him again.

Professor that has been teaching 40+ years, so he really knows how to engage you in class. Not an easy A, and will make you think critically, but completely worth it. You will need the textbooks for the course and he takes roll every day. He made the semester enjoyable and is a really compassionate professor with a great sense of humor!
